_header: Under a law as I me lay
_description: ‘For faute of loue I stand alone’ — one cross-rhymed quatrain, possibly a religious parody of a secular lyric

YorkMinActa.Editions:
Cawley,  Arthur C. 
             “A York Fragment of Middle English Secular Lyric.” 
             Speculum
         26 (1951): 142-4: 142-3.
